text: Preheat your oven to 350 °F (177 °C). Let the oven heat itself up while you're cooking, and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Beat 1.5 cups (350 mL) of sugar and the butter until well mixed and creamy. An electric mixer will make this easier. Crack the egg in a separate bowl to avoid shell pieces in the batter. Lightly sprinkle water on your finger and extract any unwanted pieces of shell. Beat the egg into the mixture, and add the strawberry purée when smooth. Mix well. Stir flour, vanilla extract, baking powder, and salt into the mixture with a spoon until the flour is entirely incorporated with the dough.  Mix the remaining white sugar along with the red sugar in a separate bowl. Set aside. Roll the dough into walnut-sized balls (or experiment with whatever size you fancy). Then roll them in the red sugar mixture. Place each ball around 1.5 inches (3.8 cm) apart onto your prepared baking sheet. Lightly press to flatten. Bake until lightly brown, which should be around 10 to 15 minutes.  Cool and serve topped with sliced strawberries to taste!
